docs.lead_paragraph: Escalating violence in Yemen has devastated the country's health system and exposed millions of children to the threat of preventable diseases including measles, pneumonia and diarrhea, the United Nations children's agency UNICEF said on Tuesday.

headline.main: Millions of Children Face Disease, Malnutrition in War-Torn Yemen: U.N.
headline.print_headline: Millions of Children Face Disease, Malnutrition in War-Torn Yemen: U.N.

docs.snippet: Escalating violence in Yemen has devastated the country's health system and exposed millions of children to the threat of preventable diseases including measles, pneumonia and diarrhea, the United Nations children's agency UNICEF said on Tuesday.

docs.lead_paragraph: Democratic fund-raising has become more ideologically aligned with the party’s liberal activists, according to a New York Times analysis of data collected by the Center for Responsive Politics.

headline.main: Hillary Clinton Faces a More Liberal Democratic Fund-Raising Landscape
headline.print_headline: Clinton Courts Donors in a More Polarized Pool

docs.abstract: Data collected by watchdog group Center for Responsive Politics shows Democratic fund-raising has changed dramatically since Hillary Clinton's 2008 presidential bid, veering more toward party's liberal wing; shift is boon for Clinton's primary rivals, like Sen Bernie Sanders of Vermont, and Clinton's campaign and speeches suggest she is focusing on issues that appeal to grass-roots donors.
docs.snippet: Democratic fund-raising has become more ideologically aligned with the party’s liberal activists, according to a New York Times analysis of data collected by the Center for Responsive Politics.

byline.original: By NICHOLAS CONFESSORE and DEREK WILLIS

docs.lead_paragraph: Public schools across America will soon offer Greek yogurt as a meat substitute in school lunches beginning this fall.

headline.main: Chobani Selected as Greek Yogurt Provider for School Lunches
headline.print_headline: Chobani Selected as Greek Yogurt Provider for School Lunches

docs.snippet: Public schools across America will soon offer Greek yogurt as a meat substitute in school lunches beginning this fall.

docs.lead_paragraph: When Susannah Mushatt Jones and Emma Morano were born in 1899, there was not yet world war or penicillin, and electricity was still considered a marvel. The women are believed to be the last two in the world with birthdates in the 1800s.

headline.main: A World Apart: 2 Women With Birthdates in 1800s Still Alive
headline.print_headline: A World Apart: 2 Women With Birthdates in 1800s Still Alive

docs.snippet: When Susannah Mushatt Jones and Emma Morano were born in 1899, there was not yet world war or penicillin, and electricity was still considered a marvel. The women are believed to be the last two in the world with birthdates in the 1800s.
